isis.stitle: NEWAY AIR SUSPENSION - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EQUALIZING BEAMS

figure.caption: Figure 13. EQUALIZER BEAM FRONT PIVOT CONNECTION

note.para: When replacing pivot bushings, replace the hardware items.

step1.para: Unload vehicle and block wheels to prevent vehicle from rolling. Raise vehicle frame 2 inches (51mm) and support with floor stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being per- formed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Exhaust air from vehicle and suspension system. Exhaust air by:

note.para: Even if air spring system has a leak and is deflated, the air must still be exhausted from system.

step2.para: Automatic control - height control valve - disconnect link at lower connection, then rotate control arm to exhaust (approximately 45 degrees down) position.
Disconnect air supply line from air spring.

step1.para: Disconnect shock absorbers and air springs at lower end.

note.para: Before performing Step 4, note the position of front pivot connection spacer washers (if used) for reassembly.

step1.para: Disconnect transverse beam, axle connection and pivot connection.
Inspect all parts for wear, cracks or failed welds. Repair or replace.

caution.para: Do not repair cracked equalizer beams; replace them.

step1.para: Press out old bushings with 5-ton capacity hydraulic press or use Bushing Service Tool (refer to SPECIAL TOOLS). Clean bushing receptacle(s) thoroughly, removing all foreign material. If bushing receptacle surface is damaged, dress the surface or replace the beam.

important.para: When tightening bushing bolts or torque rod fasteners to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the bushings.

step1.para: Lubricate new bushing with an approved lubricant or soap and water solution. Do not use an oil-based lubricant. Press new bushing into bushing receptacle past center. Turn beam over and center the bushing in beam.
Assemble new or rebushed equalizing beam to frame bracket with spacer washers (if used) as noted in Step 4 of Remove. Tighten fasteners to 175 to 215 ft-lbs. (238 to 292 N•m).
Assemble axle connection and the transverse beam.
Connect height control valve linkage. Check vehicle ride height.
Install tires/wheels and other components removed to access equalizer beam assembly.
Build vehicle air pressure to governor cutout pressure and use soap and water solution to check for leaks.
